SEARCH
Package view

Interface IVisualisation

All Known Implementing Classes:
Visualisation2, VisualisationBG
public interface IVisualisation
Abstraction for the visualization/animation layer of the airport simulation. Implementations render customer movements between service points (check-in, luggage drop, security, passport control, gate) and may also draw overlays like counters. The interface is UI-toolkit-agnostic in signature, but in this project implementations are JavaFX-based canvases.
Author:
Elias Rinne

  • Method Details

    • clearDisplay

      void clearDisplay()
      Clears the visualization surface and resets any transient drawings.

    • newCustomer

      void newCustomer()
      Signals that a new customer has appeared. Implementations may increment and render a counter or draw an entry animation.

    • newCustomerCheckin

      void newCustomerCheckin()
      Animates a new customer entering the check-in area. Implementations define the precise start/end coordinates.

    • newCustomerLuggageDrop

      void newCustomerLuggageDrop(double startX, double startY, boolean isPriority)
      Animates a customer moving to the luggage-drop area from an arbitrary starting point. The destination may differ for priority vs. standard lanes.
      Parameters:
      startX - starting X coordinate in canvas pixels
      startY - starting Y coordinate in canvas pixels
      isPriority - whether the customer uses the priority luggage-drop lane

    • customerAnimationToSecurity

      void customerAnimationToSecurity(boolean isPriority, EventType from)
      Animates a customer moving to security. The start location is derived from the given source from, and the destination may depend on isPriority.
      Parameters:
      isPriority - whether the customer uses the priority security lane
      from - the source stage the customer arrives from (e.g., ARR1, CHECK_IN, LUGGAGE_DROP, LUGGAGE_DROP_PRIORITY)

    • customerAnimationToPassport

      void customerAnimationToPassport(boolean isPriority, EventType from)
      Animates a customer moving from security to passport control.
      Parameters:
      isPriority - whether the customer uses the priority passport-control lane
      from - the source security lane (SECURITY or SECURITY_PRIORITY)

    • customerAnimationToGate

      void customerAnimationToGate(EventType from)
      Animates a customer moving from security or passport control to the gate area.
      Parameters:
      from - source stage: SECURITY / SECURITY_PRIORITY / PASSPORT_CONTROL / PASSPORT_CONTROL_PRIORITY

    • resetCustomerCount

      void resetCustomerCount()
      Resets any in-memory counters or overlays related to customers.

    • scaleAnimationSpeed

      void scaleAnimationSpeed(double Multiplier)
      Scales the animation speed by a multiplier. Values less than 1.0 typically speed up the animation; values greater than 1.0 slow it down. Implementations may clamp to reasonable bounds to avoid imperceptible or excessively fast animations.
      Parameters:
      Multiplier - factor by which to scale the current animation speed/duration

    • setDuration

      void setDuration(int duration)
      Sets the base animation duration in seconds used by implementations to parameterize per-leg movement. The exact interpretation may vary (e.g., total leg time vs. per-frame pacing); implementations should document their behavior.
      Parameters:
      duration - base duration in seconds
